raw_output: You are an expert molecular bioinformatician. Analyze the RNA structure and pocket data below. STRUCTURE SUMMARY: {"chains": ["A"], "total _ residues": 46, "motifs _ detected": []} POCKET INFO: {"total _ pockets _ found": 3, "best _ biomarker _ site": {"Pocket _ ID": "1", "Score": 0.043, "Druggability _ Score": 0.0, "Number _ of _ Alpha _ Spheres": 98.0, "Total _ SASA": 349.937, "Polar _ SASA": 281.102, "Apolar _ SASA": 68.835, "Volume": 1620.036, "Mean _ local _ hydrophobic _ density": 3.0, "Mean _ alpha _ sphere _ radius": 4.284, "Mean _ alp. _ sph. _ solvent _ access": 0.557, "Apolar _ alpha _ sphere _ proportion": 0.041, "Hydrophobicity _ score": 4.083, "Volume _ score": 3.333, "Polarity _ score": 8.0, "Charge _ score": 0.0, "Proportion _ of _ polar _ atoms": 67.105, "Alpha _ sphere _ density": 7.494, "Cent. _ of _ mass _ _ _ Alpha _ Sphere _ max _ dist": 19.006, "Flexibility": 0.0}} Based on the structural motifs and the detected pockets, identify potential RNA biomarkers and drug targets. Respond ONLY in JSON following this schema example: {"structure _ summary": {"chains": ["A"], "total _ residues": 46, "motifs _ detected": []}, "biomarkers": [{"id": "A45\ u2013A52", "type": "tetraloop motif", "function": "Potential ligand-binding site", "associated _ disease": "Lung carcinoma (hypothetical)"}], "recommended _ drug _ targets": ["Mg\ u00b2\ u207a pocket stabilizers", "RNA\ u2013ligand intercalating agents"]}.
